Topic.Title: Cashless Icahn won't bid for the company in it's entirety...

Message.Msg: I think most shareholders at this point want a stock deal, at least a partial stock deal, so they can benefit if Dell really does make a turnaround in the next few years. OTOH, that turnaround may only happen if the company goes private.

Message.Title: Michael Dell coming back at $15/share
Message.Msg: i don't think it's a coincidence that $13.65 is EXACTLY 10% under $15. my guess is Michael Dell has been keeping 10% in his pocket as a negotiating tactic and will try to come back at the last minute at $15 to seal the deal and blow everyone out. this is a game of expectations and Michael and Silver Lake set the bar pretty low at $13.65 on purpose - "you never lead with your best deal." $13.65 has become the "anchor" price mentally - i think the strategy is that shareholder will see this $15 and think it's a great deal comparatively. not sure if this tactic will work.
You never know what could be the last deal. MD has only one chance to increase his offer.

Message.Title: 3 "against"s the 3 proposals
Message.Msg: This is my first time voting for the stocks I owned.
Dell is going down in customer service. If you own that much stock, please bring back honest staight forward customer service back.

Message.Title: No green mail-Icahn can have Dell
Message.Msg: No green mail --Icahn buy Dell --dell stock -down -down -Michael Dell can buy back Dell for $7.00 per share

Message.Title: the reality of the DELL situation
Message.Msg: Mike Dell is not going to bid against himself. It's been months and no other bidder emerged to beat, or even match Mike's curent $13.65 offer. I hope the offer does not get enough yes.votes. This would mean DELL stock would trade back down to the $8.50 to $9 per share price range. This would give investors and traders an opportunity to buy DELL stock at a reasonable price instead of the current overinflated $13 price. Once the stock settle in at $9 or so, Mike Dell will have the opportunity to present a new offer of $11 to $12 per share. In summary, everybody wins except the people who bought in too late, at too high per share prices. Let Southeastern and Ichan lose money here, it's their own fault for paying too much. Hope this helps.

Message.Title: The reality of the Dell situation
Message.Msg: Neither Michael Dell nor Carl Ichan can outright buy Dell Computer.. Both have offered bids lower than the company value. The difference is , Carl Ichan will give you the choice of keeping your shares. Were Michael Dell offers the lowball price only. Some people don't want to see the difference, including Michael Dell, the Board and Bashford Capitol..............Vote your proxie to southeastern and keep your shares...........

Message.Title: Of course Carlito Icahn wants Dell loaded with debt!
Message.Msg: It's what he does, it's his MO, the debt will push the company into BK and he of course being a majority owner of the debt in some secure manner will have say what goes. He'll then later either dissect the company piece by piece and sell it off (probably into something associated with his original partner and long time pal Michael Milken) or some other scam where he has agreements setup that he alone can profit on. Or do what he did in the BB case in somehow managing to push through a 363 despite countless objections for a value which was substantially lower than book. Hence he pulled some scam with Ergen to make himself good since there is no way he would do that otherwise. I'll say it again, letting Carlito have the company will be one of the sorriest mistakes you could make.

Message.Title: And of course...
Message.Msg: ... how could I not mention the sob story he'll pull in any legal arena to get sympathy from the courts which will probably center on things like, if you don't do it my way all these jobs will be lost placing a judge or whoever is in an authoritative position needing to pick between the lesser of two evils. But guess what, it doesn't matter because both evils will eventually come to fruition. BB under Dish purchase were supposedly to keep a certain number of stores open maintaining jobs and benefits. It didn't take too long after the deal was done to start slamming the doors in fire sale like fashion. Send Carlito packing! Any plan involving him is leaving you out.
